stripped: farmer horticulture subsistence rice planting without loan
readable: Farmers will do horticulture for subsistence but not rice planting without a loan.

stripped: mr grow tomato last year cold dry season make good profit
readable: Mr. D grew tomatoes in last year's colddry season and made a good profit.

stripped: must notice rice tomato grow time
readable: We must notice that rice and tomatoes are not grown at the same time.

stripped: farmer might rice result might miss cropping season tomato
readable: A farmer might do rice and then as a result he might miss the cropping season for tomatoes.

stripped: farmer harvest paddy rice late able start tomato cold dry season
readable: If a farmer harvests paddy rice late, he won't be able to start tomatoes in the colddry season.

stripped: farmer good price tomato last season matter government say rice grow tomato think profit even though rice subsidize
readable: If a farmer had a good price for tomatoes last season, no matter what the government says about rice, he will grow tomatoes again because he's thinking about the profits, even though the rice is subsidized.

stripped: expect profit tomato high matter government incentivize rice
readable: If the expected profit for tomatoes is higher, it doesn't matter what the government does to incentivize rice.

stripped: half hectare tomato earn almost twice much farmer one hectare rice
readable: A half hectare of tomatoes earns almost twice as much for the farmer than one hectare of rice.

stripped: input tomato high
readable: But the inputs for tomatoes are higher.

stripped: last year tomato sell high price many mr neighbor already plant tomato year
readable: Last year, tomatoes sold at a high price and many of Mr. D's neighbors have already planted tomatoes this year.

stripped: tomato one crop access credit get credit might go tomato
readable: Tomatoes is one of the crops with access to credit, so if you can get credit, you might go for tomatoes.

stripped: farmer compare expect profit tomato increase price seed determine whether seed price high
readable: Farmers will compare the expected profit of tomatoes to the increasing price of seed to determine whether that seed price is too high.

stripped: dr fall would expect majority farmer would go tomato price tomato seed probably much compare expect profit
readable: Dr. Fall would expect the majority of farmers would go for tomatoes, because the price of tomato seed probably wouldn't be so much compared to the expected profit.

stripped: last year good year tomato farmer expect thing year price seed get high enough cut profit
readable: Last year was a good year for tomatoes, so farmers expect the same thing this year, and the price of seed just can't get high enough to cut into the profits.

stripped: dr fall expect farmer go tomato
readable: Dr. Fall expects 50 to 60% of farmers to go for tomatoes.

stripped: farmer might emphasize tomato cold dry season expect high price order get enough cash afford food high price
readable: Farmers might emphasize tomatoes this colddry season, expecting a high price, in order to get enough cash to afford other foods at their high prices.

stripped: sometimes people sell tomato pay back credit rice
readable: Sometimes people sell tomatoes to pay back credit for rice.

stripped: grow tomato cold dry season paddy rainy season keep paddy consumption order surplus cash rice
readable: Growing tomatoes in the colddry season and paddy in the rainy season, keeping more paddy for consumption, in order to have a surplus of both cash and rice.

stripped: farmer grow tomato rice benefit prevent hunger interested national big picture
readable: Farmers are growing more tomatoes and rice for their own benefit and to prevent their own hunger, but also because they're interested in the national big picture.

stripped: tomato need right type soil
readable: But for tomatoes you need the right type of soil.

stripped: cooperative leader really direct area might influence crop switch one crop another information fertilizer oh leader grow onion maybe follow
readable: Coop leaders don't really direct what the area is, but they might influence what to crop, how to switch from one crop to another; they have information about fertilizer, etc.. Oh, the leader is growing onion, so maybe I will follow.

stripped: mainly onion vegetable
readable: This is mainly for onions and for some other vegetables.

stripped: tomato industry work farmer buy local production even though always capable buy production still good market
readable: But for tomatoes, there's an industry working with farmers to buy local production, and even though it's not always capable of buying all the production, there's still a good market.

stripped: onion farmer cooperative lobby pressure government grace period harvest import stop month domestic producer sell import allow
readable: But for onions, the farmers being in cooperatives, they lobby to pressure the government for a grace period after harvest where imports are stopped, e.g. a month in which domestic producers can sell before imports are allowed.

stripped: agency horticulture crop
readable: This agency is all for horticulture crops.

stripped: effort promotion local rice sometimes increase tax rate importer rice mechanism quite different onion import market
readable: There's some effort for promotion of local rice, and sometimes they increase the tax rate of importers for rice, but the mechanism is quite different than the onion import market.

stripped: onion grower cooperative nation wide power pressure government
readable: Onion Growers' Cooperative is nation-wide so they have the power to pressure the government.

stripped: srv production podor niaye zone main horticulture zone onion dakar st louis
readable: Most of them are in the SRV because most production is in Podor, but there's also the Niaye zone that's the main horticulture zone that has onion too (Dakar to St. Louis).

stripped: tomato industry rice industry miller export horticulture
readable: Tomato industry, rice industry, millers, export horticulture.

stripped: harvest time rice harvest rice correspond seed period horticulture cropping
readable: But during harvest time for rice, harvest for rice corresponds to seeding period for horticulture croppings.

stripped: farm need labor horticulture may compete farm need harvest labor
readable: So if those farms need labor for horticulture, they may compete with farms that need harvest labor.

stripped: agribusinesse like tomato canning industry regular labor
readable: Also agribusinesses like the tomato canning industry have their own regular labor.

readable: (Something else about horticulture competition right after this but I didn't catch it.)

cold dry ssf end november december beginning february horticulture 

 rainy season vary mid june sept july mid october depend rain
readable: Colddry (SSF): End of November  December into beginning of February (horticulture)Rainy season can vary between mid-June - Sept or July through mid-October depending on the rains.

stripped: could see horticulture harvest around january early february would see lot farm onion tomato
readable: We could see horticulture harvests around January and early February (we would see a lot of farms doing onions and tomatoes).

stripped: care miller would come around april would see rice farm commercialization cold dry horticulture crop
readable: If we just care about millers, etc., we would come around April where we would see rice on the farm and the commercialization of colddry horticulture crops.

stripped: feb april would see remnant commercialization onion tomato plus growth hot dry rice
readable: Feb-April we would see the remnants of commercialization of onions and tomatoes, plus the growth of hotdry rice.

readable: We're looking at the reimbursement table again (note: for onions!!).

stripped: bulletin say remain credit come credit loan onion suppose pay june six month onion harvest full credit reimbursement
readable: The bulletin says the remaining credit comes from credit loaned on onions, which is supposed to be paid by June six months between onion harvest and full credit reimbursement!

stripped: cold season plant horticulture season rice
readable: Cold season, you plant horticulture, the other season you do rice.

stripped: farmer prefer horticulture cold season time sell start rice rainy season
readable: So some farmers prefer to do horticulture in cold season so there's time to sell and start rice in the rainy season.

stripped: year farmer want grow potato go onion
readable: Now, this year, farmers don't want to grow potatoes; they've gone to onion.

stripped: horticulture commercialization
readable: Horticulture is all for commercialization.

stripped: rice subsistence horticulture market
readable: 20 - 30% of rice is for subsistence but horticulture is for market.

stripped: get credit horticulture government priority
readable: You don't get credit for horticulture because it's not a government priority.

stripped: tomato industry similar system extension bank onion tie private sector organization trader credit
readable: For the tomato industry, there's a similar system with SAED and banks, but onion isn't tied to any private sector organizations (just traders), so there isn't credit.

stripped: cotton peanut rice tomato crop easy access credit
readable: Cotton, peanut, rice and tomatoes are the only crops with easy access to credit.

stripped: get credit maybe pay horticulture good option might make money even rice
readable: If you can't get credit (maybe because you didn't pay), then horticulture is a good option because you might make more money even than rice.

stripped: input expensive horticulture rice payoff high investment
readable: But inputs are more expensive for horticulture than rice, so the payoff is higher but so is the investment.

stripped: onion head start
readable: so I'll do onions because I have a head start.

stripped: divide five department horticulture fishery forestry livestock health animal science social science politic focus macroeconomic policy
readable: Divided into five departments: Horticulture, fishery, forestry, livestock health and animal science, and social science & politics that focuses on macroeconomics and policy.

stripped: government let farmer know certain fertilizer certain crop dap rice horticulture producer include formula like
readable: The government lets farmers know that certain fertilizers are for certain crops (e.g. DAP is for rice and horticulture producers, which includes formulas like 9920).

stripped: maybe crop support credit time use fertilizer rice cropping time come tomato onion get fertilizer system
readable: Maybe for crops that aren't supported by credit, but most of the time they use fertilizer for rice, and when the cropping time comes from tomato and onion, they get fertilizer through the same system.

stripped: change might work within plot create furrow billon protect onion tomato much water
readable: The only change might be to work within the plot to create furrows (billons) to protect onions or tomatoes from too much water.

stripped: double crop rice yes sometimes grow vegetable season
readable: If you're not double cropping rice, then yes, sometimes you grow vegetables in the off season.

stripped: farmer plant one season either specialize rice tomato onion
readable: But some farmers only plant in one season, and they either specialize in rice or in tomatoes or onions.

stripped: season already know crop appropriate rice appropriate horticulture
readable: For the season we already know what crops are appropriate: Rice is appropriate or not, horticulture too.

readable: Third: availability of seeds: For horticulture tomatoes, onions, seeds are imported.

stripped: rice vegetable
readable: Not for rice but for vegetables.

stripped: extend tomato
readable: Now they extend to tomatoes.

stripped: finally access industrial firm tomato rice thing contract farmer cooperative processor
readable: Finally, access to an industrial firm: Tomatoes and rice are the only things that have contracts between farmers and coops or processors.

stripped: rice peanut cotton tomato facilitate access credit mechanism clear firm facilitate
readable: only rice, peanuts, cotton, tomatoes facilitate access to credit (the mechanism isn't clear but the firm facilitates).

stripped: saving might go contrarian plant onion plant everyone else plant need access credit tomatoe price low

readable: If you know what happened last season: If last year everyone planted onions but prices were low, then they'll probably change.
